CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 18, 1949, pg. 16, reads: "Corner Checkers - What is considered Pittsburgh's greatest checker club holds daily sessions at Babe's Place, corner Logan and Epiphany Streets. Shown in above picture, are the following 'masters': Albert Valentine, John Gray, Clarence Walker, Ray Harris, Joe Mitchell, R. L. Lipscomb, Richard Reed, West Wall, Ted Campbell, Claud Foster.  Clifford L. Brown Jr., standing, claims to be the 'champion pool checker player in Pittsburgh - on any board.' - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Checkers players, including Albert Valentine, John Gray, Clarence Walker, Ray Harris, Joe Mitchell, R. L. Lipscomb, Richard Reed, West Wall, Theodore "Ted" Campbell, Claud Foster, Clifford L. Brown Jr., and "Checkers" Brown wearing v-neck sweater standing fifth from left, in front of Babe's Place, Logan and Epiphany Streets, Hill District
